qas.question: What is this distinction similar to?
What modern language does not have a T-Y distinction?
What does this imply the use an extra group of pronouns for?

context: Catalan pronouns exhibit T–V distinction, like <a0_0>all other Romance languages<a0_0/> (and most European languages, but not Modern <a1_0>English<a1_0/>). This feature implies the use of a different set of second person pronouns for <a2_0>formality<a2_0/>.
